subsection_content_1: A link to one news article for each item has been provided as an aid to finding additional information on each outbreak.
subsection_content_4: . Pakistan’s Food and Agriculture Ministry announced that samples from chickens in a farm in the Abbottabad area have tested positive for bird flu. Additional testing will be performed in the many poultry farms in the area.
subsection_content_3: . The introduction of H5N1 into New Zealand would threaten 16 native species such as the kiwi, takahe and shore plovers. A two-day-long simulation exercise is being held to train officials and veterinarians on coordination and response in the event of a bird flu outbreak.
subsection_content_5: Researchers analyzing the virus that caused outbreaks in Pichit and Nakorn Sawan have found that the new H5N1 virus shows mutations that indicate gradual change from viruses that caused earlier outbreaks, according to Sakchai Sriboonsue, the director general of the Livestock Department. He stressed that the mutations did not indicate that the virus has become more pathogenic to animals or people; however, the continued evolution of the H5N1 virus might indicate that the virus continues to circulate in the region.
subsection_content_2: . The World Wildlife Fund (WWF) in Pakistan denies that migratory birds are the main source of the bird flu outbreaks in Pakistan.  Organizers of a bird watching day in Bangladesh disagree with the government’s order to use extreme measures to prevent contact with wild birds.
